javadoc:
Class for merging user defined property changes. This class can merge non-conflicting user defined property changes that were made to the checked out version. It can determine where there are conflicts between the latest checked in version and my checked out version. It can then manually merge the conflicting user defined properties. Wherever a user defined property conflict is detected, the user will be allowed to choose the property at the address in conflict from the latest, my or original program.
Important: This class is intended to be used only for a single program version merge. It should be constructed, followed by an autoMerge(), and lastly each address with a conflict should have mergeConflicts() called on it.

methods.javadoc:
Constructs a user defined properties merger.
@param listingMergeMgr the listing merge manager that owns this merger.
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Constructs a user defined properties merger.

params.name: listingMergeMgr
params.comment: the listing merge manager that owns this merger.

methods.name: getProperty
methods.comment:
Gets the property, if there is one, from the specified property map for 
 the indicated address.

return.comment: the property at the address or null if there isn't one.

methods.name: samePropertyTypes
methods.comment: Determines if the indicated property maps are for the same type of property.

return.comment:
true if the property type held by the two maps is the same.
 Otherwise, return false.

methods.javadoc:
Determines all of the property names that are available in the latest and my program.
@return the property names.
methods.name: getPropertyNames
methods.comment: Determines all of the property names that are available in the latest and my program.

methods.name: setupConflictsPanel
methods.comment: Creates a conflict panel and adds it to the indicated listing panel.

params.name: propertyName
params.comment: the name of the property in conflict.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address where the property is in conflict.

params.name: changeListener
params.comment:
the changeListener that will process the user's selection
 when it is made on the conflict panel.

methods.name: merge
methods.comment:
Merges from the property at the indicated address into the result program 
 from the program (latest, my, or original) based on the conflict option.

params.name: propName
params.comment: the name of the property to merge.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address wheree the property is to be merged.

params.name: mergeConflictOption
params.comment:
the conflict option indicating which program 
 to merge from. (KEEP_ORIGINAL, KEEP_LATEST, or KEEP_MY)

methods.name: showMergePanel
methods.comment: Creates and displays a user defined property conflict to the user.

methods.name: createButtonText
methods.comment: Creates the text associated with the button for the user's choice.

name: UserDefinedPropertyMerger
comment:
Class for merging user defined property changes. This class can merge non-conflicting
 user defined property changes that were made to the checked out version. It can determine
 where there are conflicts between the latest checked in version and my
 checked out version. It can then manually merge the conflicting user defined properties.
 Wherever a user defined property conflict is detected, the user will be allowed to choose
 the property at the address in conflict from the latest, my or original program.
 Important: This class is intended to be used only for a single program 
 version merge. It should be constructed, followed by an autoMerge(), and lastly
 each address with a conflict should have mergeConflicts() called on it.
